news_header: A fuel tanker explosion in Nigeria resulted in at least 140 deaths and numerous injuries.
news_text: On Wednesday, emergency services in Nigeria confirmed that at least 140 people were killed and many injured after a fuel tanker exploded in Majiya, Jigawa state. The incident occurred late Tuesday when locals approached the crashed tanker to collect spilled fuel. Such tragedies are common in Nigeria due to high fuel prices and inadequate transportation infrastructure. The driver lost control of the tanker, leading to the explosion shortly after the accident. Local officials organized a mass burial for the victims as the community mourned the loss.
